title: Region / state roundup : UVA quarterback Tony Muskett expected to return for Boston College game
body_text:
COLLEGE FOOTBALL
University of Virginia football coach Tony Elliott said Tuesday he expects quarterback Tony Muskett to play Saturday at Boston College.
“He’s the starting quarterback,” Elliott said during his weekly press conference.
Muskett has missed the Cavaliers’ past three games after suffering a shoulder injury in the season opener against Tennessee.
Also, UVA defensive end Kam Butler won’t play this week for what Elliott believes is a pectoral muscle issue.
- Old Dominion wide receiver Kelby Williams made the Earl Campbell Tyler Rose Award honorable mention list for Week 4. The sophomore from Houston caught eight passes for 197 yards against Texas A&M-Commerce on Saturday.
- Hampton is ranked sixth and Norfolk State eighth in this week’s BOXTOROW HBCU FCS Coaches Poll. The Pirates are 3-1, while the Spartans are 2-2.
MINOR LEAGUE BASEBALL
Tides’ Mayo named Eastern League MVP
Norfolk Tides third baseman Coby Mayo has earned the Eastern League’s Most Valuable Player award for the 2023 season.
Mayo played 78 games for Double-A Bowie before joining the Tides, hitting .307 with 17 homers and 44 RBIs.
WOMEN’S COLLEGE BASKETBALL
CAA slate revealed
The CAA has announced its women’s basketball conference schedule for the upcoming season.
Teams will play an 18-game conference slate against all 13 league foes that includes five repeat opponents.
Hampton will open its CAA schedule Jan. 5 at Drexel, while William & Mary will visit Monmouth on the same day.
The Pirates will tip off its season Nov. 7 at Providence. The Tribe will open Nov. 6 against Norfolk State.
Briefly
- Old Dominion volleyball player Teresa Atilano has been named the Sun Belt Conference Setter of the Week. The senior from San Diego led the league this past week with 130 assists, recording double-doubles in all three of the Monarchs’ matches. Atilano currently leads the country with 596 assists this season.
- Old Dominion field hockey captain Nicole Fredricks has been named the Big East Defensive Player of the Week.
- Emily Evans and Lindsey Loar scored three goals apiece as Christopher Newport routed Virginia Wesleyan 10-0 in a field hockey match Monday night. The Captains, who climbed from No. 9 to No. 7 in the NFHCA National Coaches Poll, improved to 8-0. The Marlins dropped to 3-4.
- UVA’s Amanda Sambach claimed medalist honors at the Glass City Invitational women’s golf tournament at Inverness Club in Toledo, Ohio. The Cavaliers finished second behind Florida.
- University of Virginia baseball coach Brian O’Connor has announced the addition of Andrew Behnam as the Cavaliers’ director of baseball sports performance. Behnam, an Exton, Pennsylvania, native, was the assistant director of sport performance at Elon last year, working with both the baseball and football programs.
